info.game_comments:
2012 Power Players Week game 1.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

jeopardy_round: THE NEW YORK TIMES CROSSWORD CLUES "E"

(1, 1).clue: In August 2011 this shortstop surpassed Mickey Mantle for most career games played as a Yankee

(4, 1).clue: On Monday I visited the Maryland Science Center in this city's Inner Harbor

(5, 1).clue: Using your focus & calm in all situations is called taking yoga "off" this rolled item

(6, 1).clue: The Press-Ewing was an early seismograph, recording waves from these events

(1, 2).clue: In the first Hall of Fame vote in 1936, this Tiger was named on 222 of the 226 ballots

(5, 2).clue: Of "squatting water buffalo", "one-legged king pigeon" or "happy dancing goat", the one that's a real yoga position

(6, 2).clue: If you're readying your Bodum Kenya press pot, you're about to enjoy this beverage

(1, 3).clue: This Washington Nationals pitcher entered 2012 with 92 career innings pitched & 116 strikeouts

(3, 3).clue: In 2001, Norman Mineta, seen here, motored over from Commerce to this post

(5, 3).clue: This 4-letter Hindi word is used to mean a specialized expert; it can also be your yogi or teacher

(1, 4).clue: This Oriole shortstop never missed an inning in the first 908 games of his 2,632-game appearance streak

(4, 4).clue: Thursday's plan was a lock: the historical park named for the Chesapeake & Ohio one of these man-made waterways

(6, 4).clue: Johannes Gutenberg invented a moveable-type one of these in 15th century Germany

(1, 5).clue: In 1968 this St. Louis Cardinal had an E.R.A. of 1.12, the lowest since 1914

(5, 5).clue: A guiding principle in yoga is ahimsa, this pacifistic practice advanced by Mahatma Gandhi

(6, 5).clue: Dressing men "to an Ivy League standard" has been this company's goal since 1902

(1, 1).clue: It's what you exercise when you decide against having chocolate cake

(2, 1).clue: The person accused by the state

(3, 1).clue: Twiggy remembers that in the '60s this city was "swinging"

(4, 1).clue: Operation Frequent Wind, the largest helicopter evacuation, removed Americans from this country in 1975

(5, 1).clue: Works like the one you're hearing made Scott Joplin the king of this style

(6, 1).clue: This funny guy played the title newsman in "Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy"

(1, 2).clue: A device such as an electric drill & no, you can't borrow one of mine

(2, 2).clue: A U.S.D.C. is one of these, charged with the jurisdiction of a specific region

(4, 2).clue: An operation to chop down a tree in the Korean DMZ was nicknamed for this mythical lumberjack

(5, 2).clue: Because of his reddish hair, this Italian "Four Seasons" composer was called "The Red Priest"

(6, 2).clue: He was Carl Bernstein in "All the President's Men"

(1, 3).clue: A John Lennon hit, or an anti-establishment slogan

(2, 3).clue: This "rule" is a court order banning all parties involved in a case from discussing it publicly

(3, 3).clue: Keanu Reeves was born in this Lebanese capital

(4, 3).clue: Operation Eagle Claw was a failed 1980 attempt to rescue American hostages in this country

(5, 3).clue: We'll give you a Strauss test--not related to Johann, he composed a 1915 "Alpine Symphony"

(6, 3).clue: Al Pacino plays a "60 Minutes" producer working with tobacco company employee Russell Crowe in this movie

(1, 4).clue: This 1973 act requires the president to consult with Congress about deploying troops abroad

(2, 4).clue: Florida & other states have enacted these laws that say citizens have no duty to retreat from a threat

(4, 4).clue: Neptune Spear was the code name for the operation that killed this terrorist in 2011

(5, 4).clue: Put on your cap & gown & name this Edward Elgar composition
(5, 4).correct response: "Pomp And Circumstance" ("The Land Of Hope And Glory" accepted)

(6, 4).clue: He was Mikael Blomkvist in "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo"

(1, 5).clue: Full name of the U2 pilot shot down over the Soviet Union in 1960

(2, 5).clue: In 1986 the Supreme Court ruled that the "hostile environment" type of this can be sex discrimination

(4, 5).clue: One objective of 1989's Operation Just Cause in Panama was to capture this dictator

(6, 5).clue: As Kimberly Wells, she exposed wrongdoing at a nuclear power plant in "The China Syndrome"

(0, 0).clue: This performer is the only person to win an Emmy, the Mark Twain Prize & the Spingarn Medal
